t: Amazon Warehouse Locations in Kentucky: Salaries, Locations, and Controversies - ZonHack
s: May 30, 2024 - Kentucky is one of those states where Amazon started to build warehouses as early as the 1990s. The first Amazon facility was a 1,000-square-foot leased building with 35 employees in Campbellsville. Just within 15 years, the company became the largest private employer in the state.

t: Amazon's expansion in Kentucky
s: Amazon first set roots in Kentucky in 1999 when it opened two fulfillment centers. Today, Kentucky is home to 14 Amazon fulfillment and sortation centers, one customer service center and two Whole Foods Market stores.
